newsitem.title: USA: CalEnergy, Duke, Southern may bid on 18 plants - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: CalEnergy, Duke, Southern may bid on 18 plants - WSJ.

text.p: CalEnergy, Duke Power and Southern Co are pondering bids for all or some of 18 power plants owned by New England Electric System, the Wall Street Journal said Thursday.
The paper said people involved in the process believe the plants could fetch bids higher than the $1.1 billion at which they are valued on New England Electric's balance sheet.
New England Electric expects about 35 companies to tour the power-generating plants, which are in Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Vermont, the paper said.
National Fuel Gas Co, U.S. Generating Co, which is partly owned by PG&E, and a unit of Edison International have also looked at the plants, the report said.
